item.text: In the twelfth month (that is, the month of Adar), on its thirteenth day, the edict of the king and his law were to be executed. It was on this day that the enemies of the Jews had supposed that they would gain power over them. But contrary to expectations, the Jews gained power over their enemies.

The <st data-num="03064" class="">Jews</st> <st data-num="06950" class="">assembled</st> themselves in their <st data-num="05892" class="">cities</st> throughout <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="04082" class="">provinces</st> of <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="0325" class="">Ahasuerus</st> to <st data-num="07971 03027">strike out</st> against those who were <st data-num="01245" class="">seeking</st> their <st data-num="07451" class="">harm</st>. <st data-num="03808" class="">No</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">one</st> was able to <st data-num="05975" class="">stand</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">before</st> them, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> <st data-num="06343" class="">dread</st> of them <st data-num="05307" class="">fell</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="05971" class="">peoples</st>.

<st data-num="03605" class="">All</st> the <st data-num="08269" class="">officials</st> of the <st data-num="04082" class="">provinces</st>, the <st data-num="0323" class="">satraps</st>, the <st data-num="06346" class="">governors</st>, and those who <st data-num="06213" class="">performed</st> the <st data-num="0834 04428">king’s</st> <st data-num="04399" class="">business</st> were <st data-num="05375" class="">assisting</st> the <st data-num="03064" class="">Jews</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> the <st data-num="06343" class="">dread</st> of <st data-num="04782" class="">Mordecai</st> had <st data-num="05307" class="">fallen</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> them.
Mordecai was of high rank in the king’s palace, and word about him was spreading throughout all the provinces. His influence continued to become greater and greater.
The Jews struck all their enemies with the sword, bringing death and destruction, and they did as they pleased with their enemies.

In <st data-num="07800" class="">Susa</st> the <st data-num="01002" class="">citadel</st> the <st data-num="03064" class="">Jews</st> <st data-num="02026" class="">killed</st> and <st data-num="06" class="">destroyed</st> <st data-num="02568 03967" class="">500</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st>.
In addition, they also <st data-num="02026">killed</st> <st data-num="06577" class="">Parshandatha</st>, <st data-num="01813" class="">Dalphon</st>, <st data-num="0630" class="">Aspatha</st>,
<st data-num="06334" class="">Poratha</st>, <st data-num="0118" class="">Adalia</st>, <st data-num="0743" class="">Aridatha</st>,
<st data-num="06534" class="">Parmashta</st>, <st data-num="0747" class="">Arisai</st>, <st data-num="0742" class="">Aridai</st>, and <st data-num="02055" class="">Vaizatha</st>,
the 10 sons of Haman son of Hammedatha, the enemy of the Jews. But they did not confiscate their property.
On that same day the number of those killed in Susa the citadel was brought to the king’s attention.

Then the king said to Queen Esther, “In Susa the citadel the Jews have killed and destroyed 500 men and the 10 sons of Haman. What then have they done in the rest of the king’s provinces? What is your request? It shall be given to you. What other petition do you have? It shall be done.”
Esther replied, “If the king is so inclined, let the Jews who are in Susa be permitted to act tomorrow also according to today’s law, and let them hang the 10 sons of Haman on the gallows.”
So the king issued orders for this to be done. A law was passed in Susa, and the ten sons of Haman were hanged.
The Jews who were in Susa then assembled on the fourteenth day of the month of Adar, and they killed 300 men in Susa. But they did not confiscate their property.

The rest of the Jews who were throughout the provinces of the king assembled in order to stand up for themselves and to have rest from their enemies. They killed 75,000 of their adversaries, but they did not confiscate their property.
All this happened on the thirteenth day of the month of Adar. They then rested on the fourteenth day and made it a day for banqueting and happiness.
But the Jews who were in Susa assembled on the thirteenth and fourteenth days, and rested on the fifteenth, making it a day for banqueting and happiness.

This is why the Jews who are in the rural country—those who live in rural villages—set aside the fourteenth day of the month of Adar for happiness, banqueting, a holiday, and sending gifts to one another.
Mordecai wrote these matters down and sent letters to all the Jews who were throughout all the provinces of King Ahasuerus, both near and far,

to <st data-num="06965 05921">have</st> them <st data-num="01961 06213">observe</st> the <st data-num="0702 06240">fourteenth</st> and the <st data-num="02568 06240">fifteenth</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">days</st> of the <st data-num="02320" class="">month</st> of <st data-num="0143" class="">Adar</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">each</st> <st data-num="08141 08141">year</st>

as the time when the Jews gave themselves rest from their enemies—the month when their trouble was turned to happiness and their mourning to a holiday. These were to be days of banqueting, happiness, sending gifts to one another, and providing for the poor.
So the Jews committed themselves to continuing what they had begun to do and to what Mordecai had written to them.
For Haman the son of Hammedatha, the Agagite, the enemy of all the Jews, had devised plans against the Jews to destroy them. He had cast pur (that is, the lot) in order to afflict and destroy them.

But when the matter <st data-num="0935" class="">came</st> to the <st data-num="04428" class="">king’s</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">attention</st>, the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0559" class="">gave</st> <st data-num="05973 05612">written</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">orders</st> that Haman’s<n id="2" /> <st data-num="07451" class="">evil</st> <st data-num="04284" class="">intentions</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> he had <st data-num="02803" class="">devised</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">against</st> the <st data-num="03064" class="">Jews</st> should <st data-num="07725" class="">fall</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> his own <st data-num="07218" class="">head</st>. He and his <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> were <st data-num="08518" class="">hanged</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="06086" class="">gallows</st>.
For this reason these days are known as Purim, after the name of pur. Therefore, because of the account found in this letter and what they had faced in this regard and what had happened to them,

the <st data-num="03064" class="">Jews</st> <st data-num="06965" class="">established</st> as <st data-num="06901" class="">binding</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> themselves, their <st data-num="02233" class="">descendants</st>, and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> who <st data-num="03867" class="">joined</st> their company that they should <st data-num="06213" class="">observe</st> <st data-num="0428" class="">these</st> <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">days</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">without</st> <st data-num="05674" class="">fail</st>, just as <st data-num="03791" class="">written</st> and at the <st data-num="02165">appropriate time</st> on an <st data-num="08141">annual</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">basis</st>.

These days were to be remembered and to be celebrated in every generation and in every family, every province, and every city. The Jews were not to fail to observe these days of Purim; the remembrance of them was not to cease among their descendants.
So Queen Esther, the daughter of Abihail, and Mordecai the Jew wrote with full authority to confirm this second letter about Purim.

<st data-num="05612" class="">Letters</st> were <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="03064" class="">Jews</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">in</st> the <st data-num="03967 06242 07651" class="">127</st> <st data-num="04082" class="">provinces</st> of the <st data-num="04438" class="">empire</st> of <st data-num="0325" class="">Ahasuerus</st>—<st data-num="01697" class="">words</st> of <st data-num="0571" class="">true</st> <st data-num="07965" class="">peace</st><n id="2" />—

to <st data-num="06965" class="">establish</st> <st data-num="0428" class="">these</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">days</st> of <st data-num="06332" class="">Purim</st> in their <st data-num="02165" class="">proper times</st>, just <st data-num="0834" class="">as</st> <st data-num="04782" class="">Mordecai</st> the <st data-num="03064" class="">Jew</st> and <st data-num="04436" class="">Queen</st> <st data-num="0635" class="">Esther</st> had <st data-num="06965 05921">established</st>, and just <st data-num="0834" class="">as</st> they had <st data-num="06965" class="">established</st> both <st data-num="05921" class="">for</st> <st data-num="05315" class="">themselves</st> and their <st data-num="02233" class="">descendants</st>, <st data-num="01697" class="">matters</st> pertaining to <st data-num="06685" class="">fasting</st> and <st data-num="02201" class="">lamentation</st>.
Esther’s command established these matters of Purim, and the matter was officially recorded.
